title: Clients Vote Citibank Turkey as "Best Domestic Cash Management Bank"
summary: Istanbul - Citi Turkey has been named "Best Domestic Cash Management Bank in Turkey" in Euromoney's 2012 annual cash management survey. In addition, Citi also took top honors with two regional awards and 18 country awards globally.
tag-1: Clients Vote Citibank Turkey as "Best Domestic Cash Management Bank"
tag-2: Istanbul – Citi Turkey has been named "Best Domestic Cash Management Bank in Turkey" in Euromoney's 2012 annual cash management survey. In addition, Citi also took top honors with two regional awards and 18 country awards globally.
tag-3: The 2012 cash management poll attracted the highest number of participants since its launch in 2001. Cash managers, treasurers and financial officers were polled from around the world to rate the overall client service, industry expertise and knowledge, quality of personnel, technical support and guidance, contingency plan capabilities, quality of electronic banking security and innovative payment/collection methods of financial institutions.
tag-4: Commenting on the award, Baris Tezcan, Head of Transaction Services, Citibank Turkey, said: "We are honored to have received the recognition from our domestic clients in this year's Euromoney cash management poll. Our cash management product group is committed to providing clients with robust technology, access to our global network as well as innovative tools and solutions such CitiDirect BE Mobile, Post Office Online Cash Deposit and Corporate Commercial Cards."
tag-5: Citi Transaction Services, a division of Citi's Institutional Clients Group, offers integrated cash management, trade, and securities and fund services to multinational corporations, financial institutions and public sector organizations around the world. With a network that spans more than 95 countries, Citi's Transaction Services supports over 65,000 clients. As of the third quarter of 2012, it held on average $415 billion in liability balances and $12.8 trillion in assets under custody.

tag-11: Euromoney Euromoney, founded in 1969, is a recognized leader in business and financial news and commentary. With readership of 145,000, Euromoney is seen by top executives, regulators and officials in more than 170 countries. The magazine's subscribers are mainly in Europe, with about 30%, the UK, 23%, and the US, 23%. Euromoney's annual Awards for Excellence are a banking industry benchmark. The award winners are selected by the Euromoney editors according to objective measures including profitability, growth and efficiency, as well as subjective criteria.
